message:
[[-- Make sure to play in 720P or 1080P - Check 3rd icon in player's bottom right corner --]]

This is a throw-away video to test the Rode Podcaster microphone (which is why audio is unedited), but the idea is that some operations in Angular.JS are very easy and you can make your own copies of them  and modify for your own need (just call them something else and there you go).

Here Meligy shows how simple the ng-controller is to implement if you know how to implement a directive in general (and if you don't, read the docs on it, or ask @Meligy about what's stopping you!).

To communicate with Meligy:

Visit the channel for more useful videos than this one :)
http://www.youtube.com/user/MohamedMeligy

Say 'hi' on Twitter:
http://twitter.com/meligy

And check the GuruStop blog:
http://gurustop.net

data.message: Let me guys know if this kind of videos is useful for you is very trivial and you'd like to see different kinds of content (bonus internet points for other topic suggestions).
Yeah, not sure why I published it. I just thought I'd leave it there and see how the reactions will be :D
try to subscribe on pluralsight, your will find many courses on all new JS frameworks , and you can be a trainer there  . just check

I am subscribed on Pluralsight for several months now, and this microphone (which I just started checking its pitfalls, like I must not move when recording to keep the sound level unchanged) is the favourite for its trainers (actually, at least 3 or 4 trainers are colleagues from Readify)
المحتوى حِلو وزي الفل وعاوزين من ده كتير بقى :D , بس الصوت واطي جداً جداً. وياريت لو تعمل عن الموضوع ده بالذات بالعربي أعتقد هيكون مفيد لفئة كبيرة جداً.
The voice is very very low, but I like the topic of reading source code of popular open source projects. I was thinking of doing the same myself :)
شكرا جزيلا يا جماعة. هأشوف موضوع الصوت عند االناس ده.
Thanks a lot everybody. I have uploaded another version with the voice edited here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5cwIf1l0eHE&feature=youtu.be
